page.title: 03FARMING IN CROOK,CUMBRIA
page.content: FARMS IN THE AREA ARE SMALL,WITH MIXED DAIRY,BEEF AND SHEEP.CROPS FOR HAY AND SILAGE ARE GROWN FOR FODDER DURING LONG AND OFTEN SEVERE WINTERS.MOST OF THE LAND IS FIT ONLY FOR GRAZING,DUE TO ROCKY OUTCROPS AND SMALL TARNS.FRESIAN COWS ARE MOST POPULAR, AS THEY GIVE A GOOD MILK YIELD,AND 'MASHAMS',A CROSS BREED,STURDY SHEEP, USUALLY BEARING TWO LAMBS PER YEAR.THE MILK YIELD IS TAKEN BY TANKER INTO THE KENDAL MILK MARKETING BOARD'S CREAMERY FOR PROCESSING INTO BUTTER,DRIED MILK AND BABY FOOD.THERE IS A MUSHROOM FARM WHICH SUPPLIES CULTIVATED MUSHROOMS TO THE TRADE,AND ONE SMALLHOLDING SELLS VEGETABLES AT THE LOCAL MARKET,HELD TWICE A WEEK IN KENDAL.TWO SMALL FIRMS HIRE OUT AGRICULTURAL MACHINERY ON A DAILY BASIS,THE FARMS BEING TOO SMALL TO AFFORD THEIR OWN EQUIPMENT.
